snippet: Cory Mason, who was attacked with an ice pick and robbed six years ago after cashing a paycheck, said he now sees only shadows.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on New York City panhandler Cory Mason, nearly blinded in 2006 after being attacked with an ice pick on a train platform in Harlem; lost his job and home as a result of the attack, and began begging on the city's subways for a living, where he makes enough to support himself, a wife and three children.
lead_paragraph: Cory Mason, who was attacked with an ice pick and robbed six years ago after cashing a paycheck, said he now sees only shadows.

headline.seo: Subway Panhandler Who Lost an Eye to an Ice Pick Attack
headline.main: Maimed on a Subway Platform, Now Panhandling on the Trains
headline.print_headline: Maimed on a Subway Platform, and Now Panhandling on the Trains
